action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I am starting with "table," a common five-letter English word that uses frequently occurring letters.
guess: table

attempts = 1
target_word = audio
guess = table
guess_feedback = t<red> a<yellow> b<red> l<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: t<red> a<yellow> b<red> l<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: From the feedback, "a" is in the word but not in the second position. All other letters (t, b, l, e) are not in the word. I will try "march," which places "a" in a new position and uses new letters.
guess: march

attempts = 2
target_word = audio
guess = march
guess_feedback = m<red> a<yellow> r<red> c<red> h<red>

guess_feedback: m<red> a<yellow> r<red> c<red> h<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "a" is still yellow, so it is in the word but not in the second or third position. All other letters tried so far (t, b, l, e, m, r, c, h) are not in the word. I will try "pasta," placing "a" in the fourth position and using new letters.
guess: pasta

attempts = 3
target_word = audio
guess = pasta
guess_feedback = p<red> a<yellow> s<red> t<red> a<red>

guess_feedback: p<red> a<yellow> s<red> t<red> a<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "a" is still yellow, so it must be in the first position. All other letters (p, s, t, second "a") are not in the word. I will try "adown," placing "a" in the first position and using new letters.
guess: adown

attempts = 4
target_word = audio
guess = adown
guess_feedback = a<green> d<yellow> o<yellow> w<red> n<red>

guess_feedback: a<green> d<yellow> o<yellow> w<red> n<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "a" is correct in the first position. "d" and "o" are in the word but not in the second and third positions, respectively. "w" and "n" are not in the word. I will try "adopt," placing "a" first, "d" in a new position, and "o" in a new position, with new letters "p" and "t."
guess: adopt

attempts = 5
target_word = audio
guess = adopt
guess_feedback = a<green> d<yellow> o<yellow> p<red> t<red>

guess_feedback: a<green> d<yellow> o<yellow> p<red> t<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "a" is correct in the first position. "d" and "o" are in the word but not in the second or third positions. "p" and "t" are not in the word. I will try "audio," placing "a" first, "d" in the fourth position, and "o" in the fifth position, with new letters "u" and "i."
guess: audio

attempts = 6
target_word = audio
guess = audio
guess_feedback = a<green> u<green> d<green> i<green> o<green>

guess_explanation: I am starting with "table," a common five-letter English word that uses frequently occurring letters.
From the feedback, "a" is in the word but not in the second position. All other letters (t, b, l, e) are not in the word. I will try "march," which places "a" in a new position and uses new letters.

"a" is still yellow, so it is in the word but not in the second or third position. All other letters tried so far (t, b, l, e, m, r, c, h) are not in the word. I will try "pasta," placing "a" in the fourth position and using new letters.
"a" is still yellow, so it must be in the first position. All other letters (p, s, t, second "a") are not in the word. I will try "adown," placing "a" in the first position and using new letters.

"a" is correct in the first position. "d" and "o" are in the word but not in the second and third positions, respectively. "w" and "n" are not in the word. I will try "adopt," placing "a" first, "d" in a new position, and "o" in a new position, with new letters "p" and "t."

"a" is correct in the first position. "d" and "o" are in the word but not in the second or third positions. "p" and "t" are not in the word. I will try "audio," placing "a" first, "d" in the fourth position, and "o" in the fifth position, with new letters "u" and "i."
